citations.narrative:
On September 9, 2024, a 4-year-old male cynomolgus macaque died after being found unresponsive during a procedure
chair restraint. The animal was part of a group of multiple non-human primates in two rooms all undergoing the same
procedure using the same equipment. Upon finding the unresponsive animal, staff then discovered the neck plate holding
the macaque had slipped down the pole in the back of the chair. According to the research facility, this may have caused
the animal to assume a hunched position that restricted the animal’s airway.
The animals were undergoing a one-hour infusion, and this incident occurred near the end of the one-hour procedure for
that animal. Upon discovering the macaque unresponsive in the chair, staff intervened and provided immediate care.
However, attempts to resuscitate the animal were unsuccessful.
Handling of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause physical
harm.
Correct by: November 7, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Eduardo Vivas, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.38(f)(1)  Critical
   
Miscellaneous. 
On September 9, 2024, a 4-year-old male cynomolgus macaque died after being found unresponsive during a procedure 
chair restraint. The animal was part of a group of multiple non-human primates in two rooms all undergoing the same 
procedure using the same equipment. Upon finding the unresponsive animal, staff then discovered the neck plate holding 
the macaque had slipped down the pole in the back of the chair. According to the research facility, this may have caused 
the animal to assume a hunched position that restricted the animal’s airway. 
 
The animals were undergoing a one-hour infusion, and this incident occurred near the end of the one-hour procedure for 
that animal. Upon discovering the macaque unresponsive in the chair, staff intervened and provided immediate care. 
However, attempts to resuscitate the animal were unsuccessful.  
 
Handling of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause physical 
harm. 
 
Correct by: November 7, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Eduardo Vivas, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
